newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Syntellect sees Q2 loss.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Syntellect sees Q2 loss.

text.p: Stocks traded in line with their closing prices on Monday, traders said, with Syntellect Inc halted as it released warnings of a second quarter earnings loss.
The voice response systems supplier forecast an earnings loss in the range of $0.19 per share to $0.22 per share after the bell, compared with a loss of $0.03 per share for the year-ago period.
"Nothing is really changing direction here after the close," a dealer said.
Software company Wall Data also remained halted as it reported that it would take a $10.7 million charge to settle a class action lawsuit.
Medical device comapany Boston Scientific, meanwhile, traded unchanged, at 63-1/4, after reporting second quarter sales of $474 million, up from $379 million for the year-ago period.

The New York Stock Exchange said session one volume was 3,200, compare with 24,200 on Thursday before the July 4th three-day weekend, and session two volume fell to 1,557,500, compared with Thursday's 4.6 million.
